sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: NioCorp Board sign off Elk Creek critical minerals project underground portal project
feed.summary: NioCorp's Board of Directors has approved the Mine Portal Project for the Elk Creek critical minerals project in Nebraska, USA. This initiative will establish the primary entrances for the underground mine, facilitating access for personnel, equipment, and materials. The project, expected to cost approximately $44.6 million and begin in Q1 2026, will utilize the electric Railveyor™ system, which is projected to reduce capital costs and offer environmental benefits compared to conventional diesel systems.

feed.title: NioCorp Developments (NASDAQ:NB) Trading Down 5.4% - Should You Sell?
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments (NASDAQ:NB) saw its stock price drop by 5.4% during Friday's mid-day trading, closing at $5.769 with significantly reduced volume. Analyst opinions are mixed, with a consensus "Moderate Buy" and an average price target of $7.25, though the company is currently loss-making. NioCorp is focused on its Elk Creek Critical Minerals Project in Nebraska, aiming to produce niobium, scandium, and titanium.

feed.title: NioCorp to begin construction of mine portal
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd. will begin construction on a mine portal for its Elk Creek Critical Minerals Project. This portal will serve as the primary access for personnel, equipment, and materials for the underground mine. The project, estimated at $44.6 million, is expected to commence in the first quarter of 2026 and will incorporate the electric Railveyor™ system for material handling.

feed.title: NioCorp and Atossa Therapeutics Interviews to Air on the RedChip Small Stocks, Big Money(TM) Show on Bloomberg TV
feed.summary: RedChip Companies will feature interviews with NioCorp Developments Ltd. (Nasdaq:NB) and Atossa Therapeutics, Inc. (Nasdaq:ATOS) on their "RedChip Small Stocks, Big Money™" show on Bloomberg TV this Saturday, August 30, at 7 p.m. ET. Mark Smith, CEO of NioCorp, will discuss the Elk Creek Project, a critical minerals mine, while Dr. Steven Quay, CEO of Atossa Therapeutics, will highlight their strategic approach to breast cancer treatment with (Z)-endoxifen. Both companies are clients of RedChip Companies.

feed.title: NioCorp to begin construction of mine portal
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd. has approved the construction of a mine portal for its Elk Creek Critical Minerals Project, a $44.6 million initiative. This project will establish main entrances for personnel, equipment, and materials for the underground mine, with work expected to start in Q1 2026. The portal will also support the implementation of the electric Railveyor™ system for material handling, offering environmental and operational benefits.

feed.title: NioCorp Developments to Present at "Critical Minerals Summit: Accelerating the Mining of U.S. Critical Minerals" Conference Presented by Maxim Group LLC on Tuesday, May 6th
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd. announced its participation in a virtual "Critical Minerals Summit: Accelerating the Mining of U.S. Critical Minerals" conference hosted by Maxim Group LLC on Tuesday, May 6th, 2025. The company will join a panel discussion on U.S. critical minerals projects and hold a separate company discussion. NioCorp intends to produce niobium, scandium, and titanium, and potentially rare earths, from its project in Southeast Nebraska.

feed.title: Major critical minerals mine in Nebraska is about to start digging
feed.summary: NioCorp (Nasdaq: NB) has received board approval for its Mine Portal Project at the Elk Creek critical minerals site in Nebraska, with work expected to begin in Q1 2026 and an estimated capital cost of $44.6 million. This project will establish the main underground mine entrances and integrate the electric Railveyor™ bulk-handling system, which is anticipated to reduce initial capital costs and shorten pre-development timing. The company is continuing efforts to secure remaining financing for the Elk Creek Project, which aims to produce niobium, scandium, and titanium, with potential for rare earths.

feed.title: NioCorp board approves mine portal project for Elk Creek development
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd. (NASDAQ:NB) announced that its board has approved the Mine Portal Project for its Elk Creek Critical Minerals Project in Nebraska, with work expected to start in Q1 2026. This $44.6 million project will create main entrances to the underground mine, replacing a twin-shaft design with a Railveyor system to reduce capital costs. The initiative is a critical step towards securing financing for the project, which aims to produce niobium, scandium, and titanium, with potential rare earth production.

feed.title: NioCorp’s Elk Creek Mine Is The Big Bet On US Niobium
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd. (NASDAQ: NB) is a pre-revenue mineral explorer focused on its Elk Creek project, home to a significant niobium deposit along with scandium and titanium resources. The company aims to become a secure US supplier of these critical minerals for aerospace, EV, and defense applications. Despite a 390% stock surge over the past year due to progress and financing, its future hinges on a Q1 2026 feasibility study outcome, successful permitting, and securing $600M-$1B in construction financing to address dilution and execution risks inherent in its early-stage development.

feed.title: What's Driving the Market Sentiment Around NioCorp Developments Ltd?
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd's short interest as a percent of float has fallen by 19.97% since its last report, indicating a potentially more bullish sentiment among investors. With 7.15 million shares sold short, representing 6.29% of available shares, it would take traders 1.67 days to cover their positions. Compared to its peers, NioCorp's short interest is lower than the average of 6.92%.

feed.title: NioCorp’s Elk Creek Project Gains Strong Support at Nebraska Town Hall
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments held a town hall in Nebraska, securing strong local and governmental support for its Elk Creek Critical Minerals Project. The project is highlighted as crucial for U.S. national security and economic growth, endorsed by Nebraska's Governor and U.S. Senators. The company continues to advance the project, which aims to create jobs and reduce reliance on foreign mineral sources, with analysts issuing a Buy rating and a $15.00 price target for NB stock.

feed.title: NioCorp Provides Preliminary Financial Results for the Three and Nine Month Periods Ended March 31, 2025
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd. announced preliminary financial results for the three and nine-month periods ended March 31, 2025. The company reported a loss of $5.4 million ($0.11 per share) for the three-month period and $8.0 million ($0.17 per share) for the nine-month period. These preliminary results are unaudited and subject to change, with the full financial statements expected to be filed on Form 10-Q by May 15, 2025.

feed.title: NioCorp to Showcase Elk Creek Project at RedChip Conference
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd. announced that CEO Mark A. Smith will present at the RedChip Companies Inc. virtual conference on December 10, 2025. The presentation will highlight the Elk Creek Critical Minerals Project and its potential to establish U.S. production of critical minerals like niobium, scandium, and titanium, aiming to enhance the company's industry position. An analyst recently rated NB stock as a Buy with a $9.50 price target.

feed.title: NioCorp to Participate in the Race to Onshore Critical Minerals Conference on Dec. 10
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd. (Nasdaq: NB) CEO Mark A. Smith will present at the RedChip Metals & Mining: The Race to Onshore Critical Minerals Virtual Investor Conference on December 10, 2025, at 11:00 a.m. ET. He will discuss the Elk Creek Critical Minerals Project and its potential for onshore U.S. production of critical minerals like niobium, scandium, titanium, and rare earth elements. A Q&A session with Investor Relations Director Alex Guthrie will follow the presentation.

feed.title: NioCorp stock price target raised to $9.50 from $8.25 at H.C. Wainwright
feed.summary: H.C. Wainwright has raised its price target for NioCorp Developments Ltd. to $9.50 from $8.25, maintaining a Buy rating, citing increased popularity of rare earths and the company's liquidity. This follows a town hall event in Nebraska and recent strategic moves by NioCorp, including acquisitions and a partnership with Lockheed Martin to develop scandium-based defense technology. The company's stock has shown strong momentum, with significant returns over the past year.

feed.title: NioCorp price target raised to $9.50 from $8.25 at H.C. Wainwright
feed.summary: H.C. Wainwright has increased its price target for NioCorp (NB) shares to $9.50 from $8.25, while maintaining a Buy rating. This update comes with a promotional offer from TipRanks for its Premium services. The article also briefly mentions recent NioCorp developments including an acquisition and a shareholder rights plan.

feed.title: HC Wainwright & Co. Maintains NioCorp Developments (NB) Buy Recommendation
feed.summary: HC Wainwright & Co. has reiterated its Buy recommendation for NioCorp Developments (NB), with an average one-year price target of $11.86/share, suggesting an 82.14% upside. Institutional ownership in NioCorp has significantly increased, with 205 funds reporting positions and a 124.70% rise in total shares owned by institutions in the last quarter. The put/call ratio of 0.14 indicates a bullish outlook for the company.

feed.title: NioCorp's Acquisition of FEA Materials Paves the Way for a US Scandium Supply Chain
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments has acquired FEA Materials for US$8.4 million, a strategic move to establish the first fully integrated scandium supply chain in the U.S. This acquisition allows NioCorp to produce aluminum-scandium master alloy directly from scandium oxide, complementing its Elk Creek project. Combined with a Pentagon award and collaboration with Lockheed Martin, NioCorp aims to secure a domestic mine-to-market supply chain for scandium, reducing reliance on foreign sources.

feed.title: NioCorp Developments Completes Acquisition of FEA Materials
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments, via its subsidiary NioCorp Advanced Metals and Alloys, has acquired FEA Materials for $8.4 million. This acquisition, completed on December 4, 2025, aims to enable NioCorp to produce aluminum-scandium master alloy in the U.S., establishing a vertically integrated scandium supply chain. The move supports defense and commercial market demand and aligns with NioCorp's plans to mine scandium-containing ore at its Elk Creek Project.

feed.title: NioCorp (NASDAQ: NB) sets Dec. 5 town halls with Sen. Ricketts, Gov. Pillen
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments (NASDAQ:NB) has announced that U.S. Senator Pete Ricketts and Governor Jim Pillen will speak at separate town hall meetings on December 5, 2025, in Elk Creek, Nebraska, to discuss progress on the Elk Creek Critical Minerals Project. Attendance is free with advance registration, and video recordings will be made available online after the events. These gatherings offer an opportunity for the public to engage with company executives and political leaders regarding the critical minerals initiative.

feed.title: NioCorp adopts limited-duration shareholder rights plan
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd. has adopted a limited-duration shareholder rights plan, or "poison pill," effective immediately until May 21, 2026, to protect against unsolicited takeover attempts. This measure was taken despite the company's strong financial health and is not in response to any current acquisition proposals. The plan allows shareholders to purchase additional shares at a discount if an entity acquires 20% or more of NioCorp's common shares without adhering to "Permitted Bid" provisions.

feed.title: NioCorp Developments (NB) Price Target Increased by 111.36% to 11.86
feed.summary: The average one-year price target for NioCorp Developments (NasdaqGM:NB) has increased by 111.36% to $11.86 per share, up from $5.61. This adjustment reflects bullish sentiment, with the latest targets ranging from $8.33 to $15.75 per share, representing a 55.71% increase from the last closing price of $7.62. Institutional ownership has significantly grown, with 161 funds reporting positions and a 244.41% increase in total shares owned by institutions over the last three months.

feed.title: Is NioCorp Developments Ltd Gaining or Losing Market Support?
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd's short interest has decreased by 11.69% since its last report, with 5.56 million shares sold short, representing 6.12% of the float. It would take traders 1.0 days to cover their short positions on average. The company's short interest is less than most of its peers, which have an average short interest as a percentage of float of 6.51%.

feed.title: NioCorp to Participate in the 2025 Maxim Growth Summit in NYC on October 22-23, 2025 - MarketScreener
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd. announced that its Executive Chairman and CEO, Mark Smith, will participate in the 2025 Maxim Growth Summit in New York City from October 22-23, 2025. Smith will speak on a Critical Mineral Supply Chain Development panel and hold meetings with investors and analysts. Additionally, NioCorp will participate in the ThinkEquity Conference on October 30, 2025, where Smith will deliver a corporate presentation.

feed.title: NioCorp Developments : Elk Creek Critical Minerals Project Highlighted on Schwab’s Trading360 Program - MarketScreener
feed.summary: NioCorp Chairman and CEO Mark Smith appeared on Schwab Network's Trading360 program to discuss the Elk Creek Critical Minerals Project. Smith highlighted the project's role in reshoring America's critical mineral supply chains, specifically for niobium, scandium, and titanium, which the U.S. currently heavily imports. He also addressed the geopolitical significance of domestic critical mineral production amidst China's dominance in the global market.

feed.title: NioCorp Advances Elk Creek Project with Successful Drill Results - TipRanks
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments announced the completion of its first diamond drill hole at the Elk Creek Project, funded by the Pentagon. The successful drill results support the conversion of mineral resources and reserves, which is crucial for securing up to $800 million in debt financing from the EXIM Bank. This development advances the company’s financing and development efforts for its critical minerals project in Southeast Nebraska.

feed.title: Niocorp Developments Ltd. Reports Assay Results from First Complete Diamond Drill Hole from Drilling Program - MarketScreener
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd. reported initial assay results from its drilling program at its critical minerals project in Southeast Nebraska. The company emphasized that these initial assay results require further technical work and analysis for conversion into formal reserve or resource estimates, and may not be indicative of future results or conversion of indicated mineral resources to measured resources, or probable reserves to proven reserves. The Elk Creek Project aims to produce niobium, scandium, titanium, and potentially rare earths.

feed.title: NioCorp Developments (NB) Sees Notable Borrow Rate Increase - GuruFocus
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd (NB) has experienced a significant increase in its indicative borrow rate to 4.28%, signaling increased investor attention. The company, which operates in the Metals & Mining industry with a market cap of $1.09 billion, faces financial challenges including zero revenue and negative profitability. Despite strong liquidity, caution is advised due to its high valuation and financial vulnerabilities reflected in its GF Score of 30.

feed.title: NioCorp to Engage with Investors at Key NYC Conferences - TipRanks
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments (NB) announced its participation in two key investor conferences in New York City: the 2025 Maxim Growth Summit and the ThinkEquity Conference. CEO Mark Smith will discuss critical mineral supply chains and strategic initiatives to enhance the company's visibility and investor relations. NioCorp is developing the Elk Creek Project for critical minerals like niobium, scandium, and titanium, and is also evaluating rare earth elements production.

feed.title: Oct 30 10:00 AM ET webcast: NioCorp CEO Mark Smith presents at ThinkEquity; joins Maxim panel Oct 23 - Stock Titan
feed.summary: NioCorp Executive Chairman and CEO Mark Smith will participate in two New York City investor events in October 2025: the Maxim Growth Summit and the ThinkEquity Conference. At the Maxim Growth Summit, Smith will join a Critical Mineral Supply Chain Development panel on October 23, with NioCorp also holding 1x1 investor meetings. At the ThinkEquity Conference on October 30, Smith will deliver a 30-minute corporate presentation that will be broadcast live via webcast.

feed.title: NioCorp Developments Ltd. (NB) Stock Price | Live Quotes & Charts | NSD - StocksToTrade
feed.summary: This article provides real-time stock information for NioCorp Developments Ltd. (NB), including its current stock price and daily change. It also covers the absence of recent analyst ratings and earnings information for the company. The page features a promotional section about finding "supernova" stocks.

feed.title: NioCorp Developments Ltd. (NB) Stock: Drops 17% as the Company Secures $150M Direct Offering for Elk Creek Project - parameter.io
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd. (NB) saw its stock drop nearly 17% following the announcement of a $150.2 million registered direct offering in the U.S. This capital raise, which included the issuance of common shares and pre-funded warrants, is intended to fund the construction and operational expenses of the Elk Creek Project in Nebraska. Despite short-term market pressure from equity dilution, the offering strengthens NioCorp's long-term financial position to advance the critical minerals project.

feed.title: NioCorp Developments Closes $150.2 Million 'At-the-Market' Direct Offering - MarketScreener
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd. has successfully closed a $150.2 million "at-the-market" direct offering. This transaction is part of the company's financial activities as it continues to advance its Elk Creek Project, which focuses on niobium, scandium, and titanium in North America. The offering follows several recent financial movements and project developments for NioCorp.

feed.title: NioCorp Secures $150.2 Million to Advance Elk Creek Project - TipRanks
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments successfully closed a $150.2 million direct offering in the U.S. These funds are designated to support working capital and expedite the construction of its Elk Creek Project towards commercial operation. The project aims to strengthen NioCorp's position in the critical minerals industry by producing niobium, scandium, and titanium, with potential for rare earth elements.

feed.title: Unusual Activity Noted in NioCorp Developments (NB) Options - GuruFocus
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments (NB) has seen unusual activity in its options market, suggesting potential volatility and heightened investor interest. The company, a pre-revenue mineral exploration firm focusing on niobium, scandium, and titanium in North America, has a market cap of $1.06 billion, a strong balance sheet but weak operational efficiency per its Piotroski F-Score of 3. Despite a near 10-year high stock price and an overbought RSI of 86.13, its GF Score of 32 indicates notable risks.

feed.title: Rare Earth Stocks Surge as U.S.-China Trade Tensions Heat Up - Wall Street Pit
feed.summary: Rare earth mining stocks in the U.S. saw significant gains, with companies like Critical Metals Corp. (CRML), USA Rare Earth Inc. (USAR), MP Materials Corp. (MP), United States Antimony Corp. (UAMY), and NioCorp Developments Ltd. (NB) experiencing surges. This surge is attributed to heightened U.S.-China trade tensions, particularly President Trump's announcement of 100% tariffs on Chinese imports in response to China's critical mineral export controls. The situation highlights U.S. efforts to diversify critical mineral supply chains and reduce reliance on China, especially for clean energy and defense technologies.

feed.title: NioCorp prices $150.2 million offering to fund critical minerals project By Investing.com - Investing.com Nigeria
feed.summary: The article reports on NioCorp's pricing of a $150.2 million offering aimed at funding its critical minerals project. However, the provided content indicates an application error, suggesting the full article text is not available.

feed.title: NB’s Stock Price Soars Amid Political Boost
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd. (NB) saw its stock price increase by 15.49% due to increased investor optimism driven by emerging clean energy initiatives and political boosts. The article highlights the company's financial overview, including a cash balance of $162.8M and a public offering that raised $155M, despite a net loss of $42.7M. Political momentum, particularly the U.S. government's focus on safeguarding essential minerals and President Trump's stance against China's rare earths strategy, is identified as a key factor in NioCorp's market performance.

feed.title: NioCorp prices $150.2 million offering to fund critical minerals project - Investing.com
feed.summary: This article indicates that NioCorp has priced a $150.2 million offering intended to fund its critical minerals project. However, the application on Investing.com encountered an error, preventing the display of the full article content. Therefore, detailed information about the offering and project remains unavailable.

feed.title: NioCorp Developments : Announces Pricing of $150.2 Million Registered Direct Offering of Common Shares Priced At-the-Market - MarketScreener
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd. announced the pricing of a registered direct offering of approximately $150.2 million in common shares at $9.34 per share. The company intends to use the net proceeds to advance its Elk Creek Project towards commercial operation. The offering is expected to close around October 15, 2025.

feed.title: NioCorp Announces Pricing of $150.2 Million Registered Direct Offering of Common Shares Priced At-the-Market
feed.summary: NioCorp Development Ltd. announced the pricing of a $150.2 million registered direct offering of common shares. The company intends to use the net proceeds for working capital and general corporate purposes, including advancing its efforts to launch construction of the Elk Creek Project and move it to commercial operation. Maxim Group LLC is acting as the sole placement agent for this offering, which is expected to close around October 15, 2025.

feed.title: NioCorp Developments (NASDAQ:NB) Releases Q1 2026 Earnings Guidance
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments (NASDAQ:NB) updated its Q1 2026 earnings guidance, projecting an EPS of -0.070, which is better than the consensus estimate of -0.090. The company's stock has seen a 5.6% increase, opening at $10.39, and analysts currently hold a "Hold" rating with a price target of $6.63. Hedge funds have also adjusted their positions, with notable acquisitions by The Manufacturers Life Insurance Company, Creative Planning, JPMorgan Chase & Co., NewEdge Advisors LLC, and Invesco Ltd.

feed.title: NioCorp (NB) Reports Increased Cash Position and Net Loss in Q1 - GuruFocus
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments (NB) announced a significant increase in cash reserves to $162.8 million as of September 30, 2025, despite reporting a net loss of $42.7 million for the first quarter. The stock saw an 11% increase in post-market trading, reflecting investor interest in the company's strategic positioning in critical minerals. The company's financial health is characterized by strong liquidity and minimal leverage, but also concerning profitability metrics and potential financial distress indicators.

feed.title: NioCorp Reports Preliminary Fiscal Q1 Results; Shares Up Pre-Bell - MarketScreener
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd. reported its preliminary fiscal Q1 results, leading to a pre-bell increase in its share price. The company, focused on its Elk Creek Project for niobium, scandium, titanium, and rare earths, saw its stock rise by over 5% in regular trading and 13% in pre-market. This news follows recent company activities including land purchases, progress with the U.S. Export-Import Bank, and recent stock offerings.

feed.title: NioCorp’s (NASDAQ:NB) Q3 2025 Net Losses Reached USD 42.7 Mn - Kalkine Media
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd. (NASDAQ:NB) reported significant financial results for Q3 2025, with net losses reaching USD 42.7 million, or USD 0.53 per share. Despite the losses, the company maintained a strong cash balance of USD 162.8 million as of September 30, 2025. The adjusted net loss for the quarter was USD 8.3 million, or USD 0.07 per share.

feed.title: NioCorp Developments : Provides Preliminary Unaudited Financial Results for the Three-Month Period Ended September 30, 2025 - MarketScreener
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd. reported preliminary unaudited financial results for the three-month period ended September 30, 2025, showing a record cash balance of $162.8 million but a net loss of $42.7 million. The increased net loss was primarily due to non-cash losses related to earnout shares and warrants, as well as expenditures on their Elk Creek Project drilling campaign and feasibility study update. The company also completed several equity offerings totaling $155.0 million in gross proceeds during the quarter and acquired critical land parcels for the Elk Creek Project.

feed.title: NioCorp Reports Record Cash Balance Amidst Strategic Developments - TipRanks
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments reported a record cash balance of $162.8 million for the quarter ending September 30, 2025, despite a net loss of $42.7 million due to non-cash items. The company successfully raised $155 million through equity offerings and made significant land acquisitions for its Elk Creek Project, positioning itself for future growth in critical minerals. An analyst has rated NB stock as a Buy with a $12.00 price target.

feed.title: A Look at NioCorp Developments (NasdaqGM:NB) Valuation After Elk Creek Land Secured and Project Milestones
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments (NasdaqGM:NB) has garnered significant attention following the securing of land for its Elk Creek project, progress in project financing, and expansion of its management team. Despite its stock surging with a 1-month return of 96.8% and a 1-year return of 480%, the company's price-to-book ratio of 35.4x is considerably higher than industry averages, signaling that investors are betting on future value rather than current profitability. The article questions whether the market has fully priced in NioCorp's future growth, highlighting potential overvaluation given its current unprofitability and lack of revenue.

feed.title: Why NioCorp is Poised for Growth?
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd. (NB) is experiencing a 7.05% stock increase due to investor optimism driven by favorable industry developments and strategic financial moves. The company is advancing its Elk Creek Critical Minerals Project, securing significant financing, and receiving a raised price target from analysts, positioning it for potential growth in the critical minerals sector. Despite reporting a net loss, NioCorp's bolstered cash position and manageable liabilities, combined with increasing interest in domestic critical mineral resources, suggest an optimistic financial outlook.

feed.title: NioCorp Developments (NB) Raises $60.7M to Develop Elk Creek Critical Mineral Project
feed.summary: NioCorp Developments Ltd. has raised $60.7 million to accelerate pre-construction activities at its Elk Creek Critical Mineral project. The funds will support field activities, land acquisition, and further fieldwork for the project which aims to produce niobium, scandium, and titanium, with potential for rare earth elements. NioCorp (NASDAQ: NB) is recognized as a significant player in the rare earth minerals sector.
